sentence.Network_en: His religiousness is dialectically related to his sinfulness.

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as sinful, you mean that they are wicked or immoral.

example.ex: 'I am a sinful man,' he said.

auth_sentence.content: But centuries of the not-yet-born will feel the results of our sinfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content: But centuries of the not-yet-born will feel the results of our sinfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But centuries of the not-yet-born will feel the results of our sinfulness.

auth_sentence.content: It might seem easier to live in a world with no sins at all, but it seems we still need some notion of sinfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content: It might seem easier to live in a world with no sins at all, but it seems we still need some notion of sinfulness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It might seem easier to live in a world with no sins at all, but it seems we still need some notion of sinfulness.

auth_sentence.content: Its Protestantism can be felt in its emphasis on man's sinfulness, and on the unearned gift of God's salvation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Its Protestantism can be felt in its emphasis on man's sinfulness, and on the unearned gift of God's salvation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its Protestantism can be felt in its emphasis on man's sinfulness, and on the unearned gift of God's salvation.
